definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Lao Wang had a sudden heart attack and died, his vacancy hasn't been filled yet.
sentences.chinese: 心脏病去世了，他的遗缺至今无人顶替。

sentences.english: Tell you how much I love you, there will be some Yique fell in love.
sentences.chinese: 告诉你我有多爱你，相恋里会有些遗缺。

definition: to fall vacant/a job opening at a high level
to supervise (troops)/to appoint (officers)/to select and assign
to fill a vacancy/to make up for a shortage/to supply a deficiency
to fill a post/to act as
to transfer/to move to another post
in the first instance/as a first priority
to hand over to a successor/to relinquish one's office
to dismiss and replace (sb)/to replace (sb or sth)
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
